{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the relevant documents, the majority of the studies suggest that uterine myomas commonly decrease in volume over the course of pregnancy. Several studies found that a significant percentage of uterine myomas decreased in size during pregnancy, with a mean decrease in volume ranging from 30% to 35%. Other studies reported that the growth of uterine myomas during pregnancy is rare and that there is no significant increase in size.
